42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4: Daniel Radcliffe, the actor who plays Harry Potter, is trying to avoid being typecast as the boy wizard. He has taken on other roles in TV and film, including a stage debut in "Equus," and will appear in two more "Harry Potter" movies. He is also braced for increased media scrutiny now that he is legally an adult.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9: Leifman is working to change the way the mentally ill are treated in the criminal justice system. In the past, the mentally ill were often moved from jails to hospitals, but many of these hospitals were shut down and the patients were left on the streets. Leifman is working to create a new mental health facility where inmates can receive long-term treatment instead of being cycled through the system again and again. This solution is a win-win for everyone involved, as the patients receive the treatment they need, families are relieved, and the state saves money.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37: The I-35W bridge in Minneapolis collapsed on Wednesday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens. Witnesses described the scene as chaotic and terrifying, with some saying they thought they were going to die. One woman, who was driving home when the bridge collapsed, said she felt a "free-fall feeling" and had a pickup land on top of her car, but she was not hurt. Another man, whose vehicle was on a part of the bridge that ended up tilted at a 45-degree angle, said he thought he was going to die but was able to escape unharmed after the bridge settled.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88: The President of the United States, George W. Bush, underwent a colonoscopy procedure at the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland. The procedure was supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb, Bush's physician, and conducted by a multidisciplinary team. No abnormalities were found during the procedure, and Bush had polyps removed. The American Cancer Society recommends that people begin getting screened for colorectal cancer at age 50.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a: The judge has ordered the U.S. Marshals Service to seize approximately 53 pit bull dogs that were involved in the Michael Vick dog fighting case. The dogs may be euthanized if they are not adopted or if they are deemed to be a danger to society. The order was issued after Vick filed a motion asking the court to allow him to care for the dogs.
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70: A 4-year-old Iraqi boy, Youssif, was injured in a suicide bombing in Baghdad on January 20. His parents are seeking medical treatment for him in the US, but face challenges including obtaining visas and security risks in Iraq. The family has received support from CNN.com users and the CNN Iraqi staff, providing hope in a nation that feels abandoned by the rest of the world.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264: The article discusses the lives of women in Iraq who are driven to prostitution due to poverty and violence. Despite the danger and stigma associated with the profession, these women see it as their only means of survival, particularly for their children. The article highlights the personal stories of several women, including Karima, who is struggling to make ends meet and provide for her children, and Suha, who dreamed of becoming a doctor but is now forced into prostitution to support her family. The article concludes by emphasizing the desperation and hardship faced by these women, who are willing to risk their own well-being for the sake of their loved ones.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d: Medina Caracas, a top commander of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC), was killed in a military operation in the jungle. He was wanted for kidnapping two US oil workers in 1997 and holding one of them for nine months until a $1 million ransom was paid. Colombian troops, backed by the Air Force, tracked him down at a FARC camp in the south of the country and found 14 dead rebels, including Medina Caracas, as well as weapons and communication equipment.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048: Tony Snow, the White House press secretary, has been diagnosed with a form of colon cancer. Doctors removed a growth from his abdomen the day before and Snow's health is improving, with test results showing the cancer has not spread and is stable. Snow is expected to start minor forms of chemotherapy as maintenance treatment.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156: A resident of New York City's Upper East Side found a military-style rocket launcher on her lawn. The object, which was described as brown, had a handle and strap, and both ends were open, like it could shoot something. A neighbor said the device had a picture of a soldier on it and was 3 to 4 feet long. An Army official said the device is a shoulder-fired, direct-fire weapon used against ground targets, basically a modern-day bazooka, and it is not wire-guided.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219: Bush will give a speech on Wednesday where he will compare the situation in Iraq to the aftermath of Japan's surrender in World War II and the Korean War. He will argue that just as the US helped Japan and South Korea become democracies, it can do the same in Iraq. Bush will also note that critics at the time argued that the wars in Korea and Vietnam were futile, but America's intervention made a difference in the long run.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf:
The summary is:

A Pan Am airliner exploded over the Scottish town of Lockerbie in 1988, killing 259 people on board and 11 on the ground. Libyan agent Abdel Basset al-Megrahi was convicted of the attack in 2001 and granted the right to mount a fresh appeal this week.
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7: Carlos Alberto moved to Corinthians in 2005 and helped them win the Brazilian league title. 35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242: President Bush will undergo a colonoscopy procedure at Camp David on Friday, his last colonoscopy was in 2002 and no abnormalities were found. The procedure will be supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb and conducted by a multidisciplinary team from the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland. The American Cancer Society recommends that people without high-risk factors or symptoms begin getting screened for signs of colorectal cancer at age 50.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605: A magnitude 4.2 earthquake struck near Oakland, California, at 7:42 a.m. ET, leaving about 2,000 customers without power, according to Pacific Gas and Light. The USGS classified the quake as "light," which usually causes minimal damage. The quake was centered about two miles east-northeast of Oakland, at a depth of 3.6 miles, and was felt indoors and may have broken dishes and windows and overturned unstable objects.
0d43b97000ff852282c89d8d105e41495c0ee9bd: The robotic camera was unable to descend further than 7 feet in the seventh hole due to mud and water. The roof was also sagging. The effort to lower the robotic device was called a "long shot" and the families of the missing miners asked many questions, but the teams were unable to find any more options. The mine is expected to be permanently closed and sealed. The six missing miners have been identified as Luis Hernandez, Manuel Sanchez, Kerry Allred, Carlos Payan, Brandon Phillips and Don Erickson.
bf0cd4ccacd4fe045995338f4c44d9cf18000226: A bomb exploded near the presidential motorcade in Batna, Algeria, 280 miles east of Algiers, injuring at least 15 people. The bombing occurred 15 minutes before President Abdel-Aziz Bouteflika was expected to arrive. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the bombing.
2f43e9dfaa43ffbddbce339a8b6403ddce43b38a: Beckham and his family will adapt to life in Los Angeles by learning the people, places to see and be seen, and celebrity endorsements. The road to major league football in the U.S.A. is well-worn for some of the world's greatest players, and the impact of overseas stars on U.S. soccer is examined. The David Beckham academy in L.A. is also discussed, along with the changing perception of soccer as a "game for girls."
eb68bc51ed4fc727a1af058192a3fef0916c91e7: The study found that a virus, known as the Israeli acute paralysis virus (IAPV), has been linked to the deaths of honey bees in the United States. Researchers from the University of Georgia and the USDA found that bees infected with IAPV are more likely to die than those that are not infected. The study suggests that IAPV may be a contributing factor to colony collapse disorder (CCD), a phenomenon in which a large number of worker bees in a colony disappear or die. The researchers plan to continue studying the relationship between IAPV and CCD to better understand the causes of the disorder.
ad021a7924ee57491cee8576499ac196b1afeb23: Northern Rock, one of the UK's top five lenders, has seen a mass withdrawal of funds by worried customers, with about £1 billion withdrawn so far. Shares in the bank dropped up to 30% in trading on Friday, and the British Bankers' Association has urged customers to "calm down" and reassured them that the bank is sound and safe. The UK government has also stepped in to provide emergency funding to stabilize the banking system. Despite this, customers are still withdrawing funds, with the bank's chief executive saying that the bank has yet to draw on the emergency cash.
9d7fc7fd9ffbfecb1c458b9929fa02e6c3538368: O.J. Simpson was arrested on suspicion of robbery after a confrontation at a Las Vegas hotel room. Simpson was accused of stealing sports memorabilia from a collectibles dealer. Simpson's lawyer said he was innocent and that the allegations were a "set-up." Simpson's ex-wife, Marguerite, said she believed the allegations were true and that Simpson had a history of stealing. The collectibles dealer, Bruce Fromong, said Simpson had stolen items from him before and that he had been threatened by Simpson. Simpson was previously acquitted of murder in 1995, but was found liable for the deaths in a civil trial. The Goldman family was awarded $33.5 million in damages.
30cb674030b01014d2c87b92f09152857e249631: The Ultimate Search, a popular reality TV show in Nigeria, has been cancelled after one of the contestants, Ogadje, died suddenly during a physical challenge. The show was set to begin broadcasting on Thursday, but it has been postponed indefinitely following the tragic incident. The prize money for the winner was 5 million naira (about $39,000) in cash, a four-wheel drive jeep, and another 500,000 naira (about $3,900) to buy clothes. The Ultimate Search has been a popular show since it started in 2004, but this year's edition has been marred by the unfortunate death of Ogadje.
d41dc7fc05273a37f0aceaf4f3e35a187f12653e: Oakley, a former employee of the Department of Energy, was arrested for attempting to sell classified information to a foreign government. The FBI and Department of Energy launched a joint investigation after learning of Oakley's intentions six months ago. Authorities intervened before any involvement of a foreign country could occur. The technology park where the incident occurred is protected by multiple layers of security systems and detection programs.
fbc6a4d0697b2a3e8b549dcb1f80a8ce7bf47e34: Chelsea's John Terry is recovering from a broken cheekbone and will be assessed during training on Tuesday to determine his availability for Wednesday's Champions League match against Valencia. Frank Lampard has been ruled out due to a thigh injury, but Michael Essien is expected to play after taking part in training.
0753a471e6908c35bcbc2daa37e21f3a8443b590: A growing number of desperate and impoverished young men in Turkey are selling their kidneys on the black market to make ends meet. These would-be donors list their drinking and smoking habits and blood type on the internet and receive offers from countries such as Germany, Israel, and Turkey. One man, Hakan, a 27-year-old security guard with two young children, received five or six offers, but is holding out for a higher price. Despite the risks, many see organ trafficking as their only option to provide for their families.
08450c1bc03472825196be1acb02ac0e13bef939: The cost of insuring actors can range from 1% to 3% of a movie's production budget, which can be anywhere from $5 million to $100 million or more. 7fa8d9beca50155fd3d71a9087a4311ce321c34b: The Italian football players are unhappy with the Italian Football League's decision to start the season on August 26, which ignores their request for an earlier start to allow them more time to gain match-fitness ahead of Euro 2008 qualifiers.

e9093ca0a82f2aba28cd2762942c04177cfbb000: The case involves members of Kilo Company, 3rd Battalion, 5th Marine Regiment who were accused of killing an Iraqi civilian, Hashim Awad, in Hamdaniya, Iraq in 2006. Thomas changed his plea from guilty to not guilty in February, arguing that he had merely followed orders.
55a6aabd120f0b18297f7efe22452f9b3aca0d8d: In loving and serving others, one finds themselves. Keeping company with those who suffer leads to healing. The memory of Princess Diana should be remembered with thanksgiving and compassion, and not used for scoring points. 06bc2f0272d033b123e9eebbb221c62d7d51c283: Mr. Kouchner, the French foreign minister, has stated that a nuclear-armed Iran would be "unacceptable" and that the West must make it clear that Iran's nuclear enrichment program will not be tolerated. He has also emphasized that military intervention against Iran is not imminent or inevitable, but that the risks are piling up as a result of Teheran's brinkmanship. Additionally, he has highlighted that the new French administration is not anti-American and that France is seeking to reclaim a role at the top diplomatic tables.
17e43e8e7d2bbbb237df78537d108c3fa917d9fb: 7. "Our House" Written by: Graham Nash (of Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young) Written for: Joni Mitchell. In December 1968, Nash and Mitchell moved into a cozy little house in the Laurel Canyon section of Los Angeles. Though commonly left out of the hippy pantheon, Laurel Canyon was sort of a commune-home away from commune-home for San Francisco society -- not just CSN&Y, but also Jim Morrison, the Eagles, Frank Zappa, and more. "Our House" was directly inspired by a lazy Sunday in the Nash/Mitchell household. The couple went out to brunch, hit an antiques store, and then returned to find the house just a bit chilly, at which point Nash literally "lit a fire," while Mitchell "placed the flowers in the vase that she bought that day." No, really. The whole tableau seemed so ridiculously domestic to Nash that he immediately sat down and spent the rest of the day writing about it.
ddcdeb9bdd19fa23f9495c85d48eeee910f33102: CMAG predicts that as much as $639 million could be spent on television advertising in the fight for Congress. Democrats control the House and Senate. CMAG's 2008 election cycle forecast does not take into account unforeseen events such as former Florida Rep. Mark Foley's House page scandal or the September 11 terrorist attacks. The sheer number of ads probably dilutes their importance after a while, and an ad will have to be really good to cut through the noise.
ee0ba7928d8987f2cb21c9a2012a76730f77de45: A Boeing MD-82 aircraft crashed in Phuket, Thailand, killing 101 people. The aircraft was manufactured in the US. Air traffic controllers warned pilots of possible wind shear, but no delays or diversions were reported due to weather conditions. The decision to land was the pilot's alone. One-Two-Go officials said their aircraft were regularly checked and maintained, and denied reports of inexperienced pilots being employed for lower salaries. The industry will be watching the investigation closely.
554fd99f28ae12472c5d99ef6383bb184744c25a: Moore responded by saying Americans pay more in copays, deductibles and insurance premiums. "We [America] have a system built on profit," the moviemaker said. He asked Gupta if the current system, which requires him to receive approval from an insurance company before performing some procedures, is cumbersome to him. "It's a shameful system, especially when I'm dealing with some of my patients," Gupta said. But he questioned Moore's apparent solution -- putting health care in the hands of the Bush administration, which Moore fiercely criticized in the past, particularly in his film "Fahrenheit 9/11." "The government actually used to do things right," Moore said in response. Moore has adamantly opposed the war in Iraq and said the government should reprioritize -- a position he took many years before skepticism of the war's success abounded in Washington. "I am sorry we've taken so much time trying to correct [Gupta's] facts here tonight instead of talking about the real issue" -- the ailing health care system, Moore said.
9e141ebc1c06d483bf85f4e5c8b3c7bc2d00ea2f: The US military is preparing for alternative air routes to Iraq in case Turkey restricts access to Incirlik Air Base. The US is considering Jordan and Kuwait as alternatives. The situation is being closely monitored as it could complicate Iraqi stability and embolden Turkish attacks on Kurdish rebels in northern Iraq.
c9160e2f5ce386dabb10517e7a5c0933c01a9546: Mohammed, a 13-year-old Iraqi boy, was injured in a bombing in Falluja in 2004. He lost his left leg and was left with no hope for the future. However, through the efforts of the non-profit organization "Children of the Revolution," he has received a prosthetic leg and is now able to walk again. The organization's founder, Montanti, has made it her mission to help other Iraqi children in need of medical attention. Mohammed is grateful for the help he has received and wants to go to America to meet the person who gave him his future back. He also wants to rebuild his school, which was bombed during the 2004 offensive, and become an architect to build other schools.
d256aee1a47eb5b489dee6fb72ab7f7d1483a37f: Indian President Pratibha Patil's victory in the presidential election has been marred by allegations of corruption and mismanagement. She has been accused of misusing her position to help her brother and other relatives, and of shielding him in a murder inquiry. Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has dismissed the allegations as "mud-slinging," but they have tainted her victory and raised questions about her fitness for office.
2fff2bc541ef34a6647dfa2e4294cdcc187e47b9: A landslide in San Diego's La Jolla neighborhood has left 30 homes "red tagged," meaning no one is allowed to enter them, and 27 more are "yellow tagged," which means residents can return for necessities but cannot stay, according to the San Diego Union-Tribune. The landslide downed power lines and caused a minor gas leak, leaving more than 2,400 customers without electricity, but most residents had their power restored by Thursday, KGTV reported. The Red Cross opened a shelter at La Jolla High School. Deputy city engineer Robert Hawk told the Union-Tribune that the hillside has slowly been slipping for years because the soil is unstable. Landslide incidents in the neighborhood date back to the 1960s, Hawk told the newspaper. Pat Abbott, a retired geological sciences professor at San Diego State University, told the Union-Tribune that Mount Soledad is made up of weak layers of rock and that the culprit in the landslide is nature. "Gravity pulling on the incline is pulling down masses of earth and those masses of earth have houses on top of them," Abbott told the paper. "It's a geologically bad site and should not have been built on to begin with."
677375a4c69e81ab623af7c06a6b0a8d03d6350e: French authorities have reacted angrily to the Zoe's Ark trip, calling the group's actions "illegal and irresponsible." The French Foreign Ministry has said the dispute will not affect France's participation in a European peacekeeping force due to be deployed along the border between Chad and Sudan. In response to the dispute in Chad, the Republic of Congo said late Wednesday it was suspending all international adoptions, The Associated Press reported. Reporters Without Borders said it will work for the release of the three journalists arrested in Chad.
33530f97118cc905b05cb920671492c7bfdf3a3b: The IPCC has projected that if carbon dioxide levels double, temperatures could rise between 3.6 to 8.1 degrees Fahrenheit by 2100. The lower end of the range could cause more intense hurricanes, droughts, wildfires and flooding, while the higher end could lead to catastrophes commonly associated with Hollywood filmmakers. However, uncertainties plague such forecasts, which are based on computer simulations and models.
3c19a753303ae0d67b3ae28e070c0f4157ffc52d: The death toll from the day's clashes in Somalia has risen to 19, including Ethiopian troops, insurgents, and civilians. Ethiopian troops arrived in Somalia in December 2006 to help a weak Somali government drive the Islamic Courts Union out of Mogadishu and restore a U.N.-backed transitional government after a decade and a half of near-anarchy. The United States accused the ICU of harboring suspected al Qaeda figures, including three men wanted in the 1998 bombings of U.S. embassies in Tanzania and Kenya, and raised no objections to Ethiopian presence in Somalia.
9313988d26672c576f08e130c895edf20d8aa626: Savio expressed fear of Drew Peterson, saying he was going to kill her. Stacy Peterson's friends and family said she expressed concerns about her husband, including an e-mail from her describing her relationship as abusive.
72f4a6670ec7ec915c83d58bb0ebf152b1605bb6: Davenport defeated Zvonareva 6-2, 6-7 (3-7), 6-3 in the semifinals of the China Open.
b73f50e29d5b2943eb315643bef8ee4e09f5605b: Minister Benazir Bhutto described a "wave of disappointment" at Musharraf's actions. Bhutto wants to lift her Pakistan People's Party to victory in January's parliamentary election in the hope she can have a third term as prime minister. The nation's political atmosphere has been tense for months, with Pakistani leaders considering a state of emergency because of the growing security threats in the country's lawless tribal regions. Musharraf, influenced in part by Rice, held off on the move.
f9689fb9656132e1c6d186851563f2b968643791: Singer, a spokesman for the National Children's Museum, was arrested by ICE agents on Tuesday on charges of child exploitation. He is expected to appear before a U.S. magistrate judge later Tuesday. The museum has been closed to the public since 2004 and is currently operating from administrative offices, with a new facility scheduled to open in 2012.
63831b842812b1a3d05b04904a10d160fe7ad2af: Elaine Thomas, a former girlfriend of Stiles, contacted police after recognizing him in photos on television. 05688bac0e46542be65a6df240428a6f26c86fd0: South Africa's AB de Villiers took a stunning catch to dismiss Scott Styris, and Dale Steyn took four wickets to help South Africa beat New Zealand by 10 wickets in the second test at Port Elizabeth. Steyn's figures of 5 for 47 bettered his previous best against the same opponents at Centurion two seasons ago, and he became the first South African bowler to take four five-wicket hauls in a row in tests. Herschelle Gibbs and captain Graeme Smith were out cheaply, but Amla and Kallis blunted the attack and then took charge, batting together for 205 minutes and scoring 140 runs.
5ba0d22ccba29ac8a3c77da069165d6016f5a214:
The article provides tips on how to tie espadrilles, a type of flat shoe, including:

1. Slide your foot fully into the shoe and plant it firmly on the floor.
2. Cross and tie the laces once behind the ankle, then bring them forward, cross and tie again, and continue up the leg.
3. Each time you cross and tie, secure the laces slightly tighter than is comfortable, since they will loosen a bit when you walk.
4. For a streamlined leg, make the final tie in the back.
5. Create a more whimsical look by putting the final tie in front with a small bow.
